data.title: The PIO who's PM
data.meta_description: Apart from Prime Minister Vajpayee, the other head of government participating in the event is Anerood Jugnauth PM of Mauritius.
data.text:
Synopsis

Apart from Prime Minister Vajpayee, the other head of government participating in the event is Anerood Jugnauth PM of Mauritius.

Apart from Prime Minister Vajpayee, the other head of government participating in the event is Anerood Jugnauth PM of Mauritius.

A PIO who is proud of his Indian roots, Mr Jugnauth feels that the event will provide an opportunity for people of Indian origin to consolidate their bonds. â€œThis will help in future pooling of resources for attaining our respective goals. It will also enable us to share our experience and to reinforce our various linkages across the world wherever we are,â€™â€™ he says.

And itâ€™s not just a bonding experience for PIOs. India and Mauritius share a similar multicultural background and an event like PBD will help the two nations to learn from each other. Says Jugnauth: â€œAs India, Mauritius is an open society where religious and cultural tolerance is enshrined in our respective Constitutions. We encourage all communities to practise their religious beliefs in complete freedom.â€�

While Jugnauth has never really considered applying for a PIO card from the Indian government, he feels that the rich religious and cultural legacy bestowed to him by his forefathers has given him and others in Mauritius the same deep cultural values that are there in India. â€œRegarding my roots, I come from a traditional Mauritian family of Indian Origin,â€™â€™ he says. And he even looks forward to Mauritius becoming the venue of PBD sometime in future. â€œAn event of such a magnitude provides the right platform for exchange of ideas, defines better commonalities of purpose, facilitates interaction and sets the scene for closer cooperation between peoples of Indian origin. It is also an important step towards building international links between nations which have a large number of PIOs,â€™â€™ he says.

Minister of foreign affairs of Mauritius A. K. Gayan, also feels that meetings like PBD should be held on a regular basis in different countries.
